meanings.sent1: He was noosing the rope to hang a swing from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy was noosing the lasso to catch the runaway calf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was noosing the skipping rope around its tail.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to noose his heart, leaving him speechless.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved noosing a ring with a piece of string.

meanings.definition: The act of capturing or trapping something with a noose.
meanings.sent1: The hunter used a noosing technique to catch the wild boar.
meanings.sent2: The noosing of the rabbit was successful, much to the farmer's relief.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy detective ended up noosing himself while trying to set a trap.
meanings.sent4: The noosing of the criminal was swift and efficient, ending the chase.
meanings.sent5: The noosing of the escaped parrot was a sight to behold, with feathers flying everywhere.

meanings.sent2: The noosing around the tree branch was set up to catch any intruders.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten got its head stuck in the noosing of the blinds.
